head.title: Alexander's Mural Going Down but Not Out

identified-content.org: Bergen Museum of Art and Science

hedline.hl1: Alexander's Mural Going Down but Not Out

abstract.p: Vornado Inc, real estate company that owns now-defunct Alexander's department store in New Jersey, donates huge porcelain mural by Stefan Knapp to Bergen Museum of Art and Science in Paramus (S)

block.p: To David Messer, director of the Bergen Museum of Art and Science in Paramus, the giant mural that has been on the now-defunct Alexander's department store at Routes 4 and 17 since 1962, ''has become the single most important icon of culture in Bergen County.''

So Mr. Messer said he was delighted this month when Vornado Inc., a Saddle Brook real estate company that owns the building, donated the mural, plus $53,000 to pack its porcelain panels, to the museum. The 48-by-180-foot image, in bold swaths of red, orange and blue on white, is by a Polish muralist, Stefan Knapp.

Carlstadt officials will allow the mural to be stored in a municipal storage facility until museum trustees decide where to display it, Mr. Messer said. One option, he said, is the exterior of a mall proposed in Carlstadt.
